briefTitle: Allopurinol Versus Febuxostat in Subjects Completing the Phase 3 Trials C02-009 or C02-010
officialTitle: A Phase 3, Open-Label, Randomized, Allopurinol-Controlled Study to Assess the Long-Term Safety of Oral Febuxostat in Subjects With Gout
summary: The purpose of this study is to determine the long-term safety of febuxostat, once daily (QD), compared to allopurinol in reducing serum urate levels in subjects with gout.

primaryOutcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Whose Serum Urate Level Decreases to < 6.0 mg/dL at Month 1.

commonTop: Musculoskeletal and Connective Tissues Signs and Symptoms NEC
Lower Respiratory Tract and Lung Infections
